content: most recently completed see photo 5 on the last repeat you will work into the 14 chain loop which consists of the 5 loops from the end of r2 plus the beginning 9 chs of r3 see photo 6 r5 r73 repeat r4 omitting the final chain-5 at the end of the last row each row should create 30 loops which alternate with the loops you made in the row before it fasten_off turn your square 90 degrees so the sides are at the top and bottom you should have 36 loops at the top and 36 at the bottom the top of the bag will be worked into these loops if you changed colors or used multi-color thread the stripes should be vertical now © marsha glassner 2018 top front and back r1 join thread with a single_crochet into the top of the loop at the beginning of r73 this will be a loop consisting of the chain-5 from r72 and the chain-9 at the beginning of r73 single_crochet in the top of each 14-chain loop working from r73 to r2 see photo 8 turn 36 single_crochet r2 chain 3 counts as double_crochet here and throughout this section double_crochet in next in each single_crochet turn 36 double_crochet r3 chain 3 double_crochet in next 16 double_crochet chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next 17 double_crochet turn 34 dcs 1 chain-2 space r4 chain 3 double_crochet in next 13 double_crochet chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next 4 sts chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next 14 double_crochet 32 dcs 2 chain-2 spaces r5 chain 3 double_crochet in next 10 double_crochet chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next 10 sts chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next 11 double_crochet turn 32 dcs 2 chain-2 spaces r6 chain 3 double_crochet in next 7 double_crochet chain 2 skip 2 st double_crochet in next 16 sts chain 2 skip 2 st double_crochet in next 8 double_crochet turn 32 dcs 2 chain-2 spaces r7 repeat r6 r8 chain 3 *double_crochet in next 7 double_crochet chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet* repeat * to * 2 more times double_crochet in next 8 double_crochet turn 30 dcs 3 chain-2 spaces r9 chain 3 double_crochet in next 10 double_crochet *chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet* repeat * to * double_crochet next 3 sts *chain 2 skip 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet* repeat * to * double_crochet in next 10 double_crochet 28 dcs 4 chain-2 spaces r10 chain 3 double_crochet in next 35 sts fasten_off 36 dcs repeat on opposite side of mesh to make back of bag sides and handles each row adds to both sides and both handles you will add gathers to the sides gradually near the top and bottom and thickly in the middle you will insert a non-stretchy cord to reinforce the handles you can use a narrow paracord shoelaces jump-rope or any other non-stretchy cord crocheted cords are too stretchy but you could use a
